Title: A Time to Kill
Description: The author is a King of Jerusalem who relates and analyses events in his own life.

Title: The House of Mirth
Description: The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning; but the heart of fools is in the house of mirth.

Title: EAST OF EDEN
Description: Steinbeck apparently considered this 1952 novel to be his magnum opus, the one which all other novels before it had merely been practice for.

Title: THE SUN ALSO RISES
Description: The sun also ariseth, and the sun goeth down, and hasteth to his place where he arose. Hemingway’s modernist novel came out in 1926.

Title: VILE BODIES
Description: Waugh took the title for his 1930 novel from Philippians, full name Epistle to the Philippians, which is part of the New Testament and generally attributed to Paul the Apostle.

Title: A Scanner Darkly
Description: One of Dick’s most famous novels (published in 1977), its title is taken from the First Epistle to the Corinthians

Title: MOAB IS MY WASHPOT
Description: The context is that people would often use washpots to clean their feet of sand after roaming the desert, and Moab, a kingdom of Jordan which was often warring against the Israelites, needed to be overcome.

Title: NUMBER THE STARS
Description: n line 147:4, the Psalms declares that He God telleth the number of the stars; he calleth them all by their names.

Title: BRAVE NEW WORLD
Description: This is possibly the most famous book to take its title from a Shakespeare play – in this case, The Tempest

Title: PALE FIRE
Description: Timon of Athens is one of Shakespeare’s less well-known and less-read plays, so it’s not often quoted.

Title: COLD COMFORT FARM
Description: Gibbons’s 1932 classic about a deeply unpleasant farm, a satire of typical Victorian rural fiction
